;After-sales concerts are becoming a standard feature of hit dramas.

;

;Following the successful after-sales concert of the popular summer drama "Lotus House", another hit drama "Sauvignon Blanc" also recently held a famous concert It is an after-sales concert for the "First Season Finale Celebration Wilderness Tour Carnival Night".

;

;However, during the live broadcast of the carnival night, complaints such as "embarrassment" and "refund" were hotly searched one after another. This is not a problem with the actors, but with the party planning. , the game session was a mess.

;

;From the earlier TV series "Chen Qing Ling" and "Shan He Ling" to the recent "Lotus Tower" and "Sauvignon Blanc", after-sales concerts have become more and more common. It has also become a new way for the platform to make money - how did the after-sales concerts become a trend? How profitable is it? What is the risk of rollover?

;

;;

;

;Stills of "Sauvignon Blanc". ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;;After-sales concerts are becoming more and more popular;

; strong>;

;

;In an era where video websites are competing for hegemony, more and more attention is paid to the "after-sales" of drama series.

;

;A drama is not finished after it is aired. If we can provide drama fans with better after-sales service and experience, we can take out more from the fans' pockets. More money can also increase the loyalty of drama fans to the platform, which will help increase the value of platform members. Therefore, after-sales services in the form of after-sales concerts, after-sales parties, after-sales sharing sessions, etc. are becoming more and more popular.

;

;After-sales concerts are generally broadcast simultaneously online and offline. Offline tickets need to be purchased at a high price, or only by purchasing a platform membership card can you get the chance to draw tickets. Online live broadcasts require the purchase of live broadcast tickets.

;

;At the concert, the main creators gathered together to sing theme songs, restore famous scenes, and play interactive games, which formed the main content of the concert.

;

;The trend of after-sales concerts was first sparked by the 2019 "Chen Qing Ling".

;

;After the series ended, the platform held two Chinese-style concerts in Nanjing, selling more than 16,000 tickets in six price ranges from 627 yuan to 1,980 yuan5 It was sold out within seconds. If you didn’t grab the ticket, you can still buy the platform’s online live broadcast tickets at prices ranging from 25 yuan to 50 yuan. "Chen Qing Ling" successfully tested the waters, allowing the industry to see the huge market space for after-sales concerts of popular dramas.

;

;In 2020, the fairy tale drama "Liu Li" became a dark horse in the summer season and gained many loyal fans. Since it is impossible to gather offline due to the epidemic, the platform has customized a cloud singing party for drama fans. Audiences can pay to watch it at prices ranging from 25 yuan (member price) to 50 yuan (non-member price).

;

;The 2021 hit drama "Shanhe Ling" has replicated the amazing popularity of the "Chen Qing Ling" after-sales concert. There were two consecutive concerts in Suzhou, with the highest ticket price reaching 2,280 yuan (more expensive than a ticket for a first-line singer's concert). 600,000 people bought tickets online, and it took 14 seconds to sell out. Online live broadcast tickets also cost 68 yuan each. .

;

;Afterwards, with the official crackdown on chaos in the entertainment industry, the format of after-sales concerts for popular dramas stopped for a while.

;

;This summer, an improved version of after-sales concerts will return. However, both "Lotus Tower" and "Sauvignon Blanc" have significantly reduced the number of offline audiences, with only a few hundred people offline. This can make the approval of performances more efficient, and can also avoid some uncontrollable chaos in the entertainment industry, and avoid Public criticism.

;

;Offline tickets are exclusive to high-level members. Only those who have purchased a one-year membership will have the chance to win the lottery. Online viewers can choose to pay to purchase live broadcast viewing tickets.

;

;;

;

;Stills from "Lotus Tower". ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;;The money from drama fans is really good< /strong>;

;

;The after-sales concert is really a "charity" for the platform. Is it going to give back to the fans of the drama and provide benefits to the fans of the drama?

;

;Obviously not that simple. If it is really a benefit, then should online viewing be free? It may be true that the platform gives back to drama fans, but it must be true that it makes another wave of money from drama fans.

;

;"Chen Qing Ling" has verified how strong the purchasing power of drama fans is. A single offline ticket for "Chen Qing Ling" was sold to 150,000 by scalpers; online VIP tickets are 30 yuan/ticket, non-VIP tickets are 50 yuan/ticket, and group tickets are 25 yuan/ticket. The total number of people in the live concert room exceeds 3.2 million. If Based on an average of 30 yuan per person, the total online revenue is nearly 100 million yuan.

;

;Not only are the offline tickets for "Ling of Mountains and Rivers" more expensive than those of "Chen Qing Ling", but the price of online live broadcast tickets is as high as 68 yuan per piece, but at no point It did not affect the enthusiasm of fans of the drama. The Douban score of "Shan He Ling Born Bosom Friend Concert" is as high as 9.5 points, which shows that fans of the drama are very happy with their money.

;

;"Lotus Tower" has changed to a new format. Even if the number of offline concert tickets is limited, they are basically not sold to the outside world. Buying members and drawing tickets can also It provides a great boost to the platform’s membership fees.

;

;Drama fans need to purchase a 448 yuan/year Star Diamond membership (or membership level V7) to get 1 chance to draw tickets, and the number of times they purchase a Star Diamond membership Unrestricted. In order to be able to draw tickets, some fans of the drama bought a 10-year Star Diamond membership in one go. The membership fee also costs 4,480 yuan, which is more expensive than offline concert tickets, and they may not be able to win the lottery.

;

;"Sauvignon Blanc" is also played in a similar way. Users who purchase the SVIP annual card of the platform can get 10 lottery opportunities, and the annual card price is 488 yuan. The platform limits the number of recharges for the SVIP annual card, which can only be recharged a maximum of 3 times. This avoids excessive consumption by fans and can also increase users’ enthusiasm for paying for prize draws.

;

;In short, there are always ways to make money when the platform holds after-sales concerts. In the short term, you can directly collect money from fans of the drama. In the long term, after-sales concerts will become part of the platform’s membership services. If there is a second season like "Sauvignon Blanc", it can also build momentum for the second season.

;

;Main actors who have starred in hit dramas will basically attend after-sales concerts. This helps extend the character's popularity to the actors. What's more, if other main creators are participating, a single leading actor may be accused of being "insincere" by fans of the drama, and may be "out of touch" or "back-stepped". . Therefore, as long as most of the core creators agree to hold an after-sales concert, the remaining starring actors will only have the option of "agree".

;

;;It pays to fool drama fans;

;

;Due to character filtering Mirror, drama fans are very tolerant of after-sales concerts. For example, if the actor is not a professional singer, they do not require him to sing well. Drama fans generally have a request, hoping to see traces of the characters in the interactions of the actors, so that the beautiful emotions in the drama can continue offline, and the regrets in the drama can be made up for offline.

;

;This puts forward high requirements for the restoration and interaction of after-sales concerts - this is why many after-sales concerts have actors wearing costumes from the drama Costumes are used in performances to give drama fans a stronger sense of immersion.

;

;"Lotus Tower" is like this, with a high degree of restoration, full of sincerity, and has been well received. Although "Sauvignon Blanc" received many bad reviews, the restoration of the Qingshui Town part of the play became a highlight of the concert.

;

;Once the degree of restoration is poor and the interactivity is insufficient, the after-sales concert will instead make the audience laugh and let the audience "get out of the trap". The previous Cloud Song Concert of "Liu Li" shocked drama fans because the male and female protagonists had almost no interaction on stage. The Douban score of "Liu Li Finale Cloud Song Concert" was as low as 2.4 points. As soon as the after-sales concert ended, the actor dropped a few points. Thousands of fans.

;

;This time the "Sauvignon Blanc" after-sales concert was criticized, it was not the actor's problem. Yang Zi's emotion for the character is still very touching. Tan Jianci was late because of a traffic jam. When he arrived, he sang, danced and adjusted the atmosphere. He was very dedicated.

;

;The problem mainly lies in the planning of the concert, such as asking the five main actors to pose strange poses in front of the flower arrangements, having Zhang Wanyi recite, and having Deng Wei Cooking, and having Yang Zi and Dai Luwa wearing high heels recreate the fighting scenes in the play... there was little restoration, and the interaction was awkward. It was originally intended to build momentum for the second season, but it actually caused some fans of the show to leave disappointed.

;

;After-sales concerts seem to be very profitable, but planning them well is not easy.

;

;When the characters in the play are like each other, the offline actors may not be familiar with each other in reality. This requires efforts in planning and in the early stages. Coordinate and communicate more with the actors. For example, you can let the actors wear costumes to continue "performing" in the play, or you can use interesting game designs to allow the actors to have more interactions.

;

;It is foreseeable that after-sales concerts of "small scale offline, money to watch online" will become a new normal for hit dramas in the future.

;

;Drama fans are willing to spend money to "buy benefits". However, it is worth noting that if the platform is fooled and really treats drama fans as "leeks", it will It will damage the credibility of the platform and also have a negative impact on the actors. When the platform wants to organize after-sales services, actors may not participate, members are unwilling to pay, and the platform has completely lost a way to make money.

;On October 26 and November 1, 2023, the famous musician Liu Jiachang published two long articles in succession Accusing his ex-wife Zhen Zhen attracted public attention. Liu's first long article elaborated on his version of the inside story of the "mother and son fighting for the birth" of his ex-wife and their son, while the second long article accused Zhen Zhen of being incompetent in raising her son and "being a shameless mother." After Liu Jiachang published his first long article, Zhen Zhen also published a thousand-word article to counterattack, and the two of them were "at odds with each other".

;

;The "Weibo promotion" triggered by celebrities' "divorce essays" once again occupied the hot search, and showed a similar plot to similar incidents in the past: one party took the lead in attacking, and looked eloquent. The words are righteous and well-founded; the other party fights back and refutes point by point, which seems to be righteous and sensible. For a time, public opinion was greatly divided.

;

;Liu Jiachang’s main accusation against Zhen Zhen can be divided into two parts. The first is the issue of division of marital property. Liu Jiachang accused Zhenzhen of transferring Liu's assets to her name in various ways over the years, including but not limited to company equity, music copyrights and cash income; the second was the issue of his son's education and growth. Liu accused Zhen Zhen of controlling his son but failing to teach him how to spoil him. He made his son drop out of school again and again and became naughty. He got into troubles including drunkenness, racing, beating people, and soliciting prostitutes. Liu tried his best to encourage his son to make music, but failed.

;

;To sum up, Liu Jiachang claimed that he "disclosed his family affairs" because of his failed marriage and hurt feelings. He posted a long article accusing Zhenzhen mother and son just to vent his anger so as not to "die unjustly". It seems inappropriate. It was all about fighting for property, because he also promised to donate his property to charity if he won the lawsuit.

;

; Regarding Liu’s first long article, Zhen Zhen also issued a counterattack, accusing Liu Jiachang of being addicted to gambling and suppressing his son. It was Liu Jiachang who stole his property, not the other way around; Liu Jiachang After the second long article was released, Zhen Zhen also criticized Liu Jiachang for slandering herself and her son, saying, "It's really shameless." Their son Zhang Liheng (formerly known as Liu Ziqian) also supported his mother on social media. The "mutual conflict" between the two sides shows that each has his own words, but in order to determine which is right and which is wrong, we should return to the level of facts and legal principles.

;

;In the property dispute between the two parties, there are many factual issues that are not difficult to prove or falsify. Written evidence can be used to determine whether these properties were earned by Liu Jiachang, or whether they were simply "registered in the name of his wife Zhenzhen" as joint property of the couple. For example, the audit report mentioned by Liu Jiachang, and the Income details, tax return records, property registration records from the three places across the Taiwan Strait and the United States, as well as legal documents regarding music copyrights, company equity, real estate ownership, and the agreements between the two parties regarding the property, etc.

;

;Zhen Zhen accused Liu Jiachang of being "addicted to gambling", and Liu Jiachang responded that "he only used his own money for gambling." Liu Jiachang accused Zhen Zhen of "not filming for forty years" and that all the joint property was earned by herself. Zhen Zhen also personally told the media that every penny earned by Liu was given to Zhen Zhen and her family. It's not difficult to prove. Liu's accusation and response can be summarized as, "It is normal for a husband to make money outside and leave it to his wife to take care of, but Zhen Zhen should not assume that she earned all the money." Whether this argument can be established is the key issue in determining whether the dispute is right or wrong.

;

;The second part of Liu Jiachang’s accusation, “Unvirtuous wife and unfilial son,” is even more difficult to verify because of its rich details and specific descriptions. Liu Wen accused Zhen Zhen of failing to teach her son well and his son was naughty and naughty. He was forced to drop out of school in Hong Kong, Shanghai, and the United States. He also got into troubles including drunkenness, beating people, speed driving, and soliciting prostitutes. Zhen Zhen even "solicited prostitutes on behalf of her son." , these are specific and severe public accusations. Liu Jiachang should be responsible for providing evidence and ensuring the authenticity of the accusations, otherwise it will be suspected of slander.

;

;Liu Jiachang also revealed in the long article that his son was able to successfully enroll in school or escape punishment many times by relying on his connections with "big men" such as Run Run Shaw. If these incidents really happened, there must be others. There are too many informed third parties who can verify one by one, and it does not rule out that there are still many cases that can be verified. Liu Jiachang also mentioned that he tried his best to help his son make music but failed. This can also be supported by the record company and related people.

;

;From a legal perspective, it is meaningless for both parties to resort to personal attacks in moral trials. The focus should still be on the common property division issues in divorce proceedings. Both parties accuse each other of embezzling their own property. This should be left to professional lawyers who specialize in marriage law and company law to litigate the game. Everything should be carried out according to normal litigation procedures; Zhen Zhen said that the two parties had divorced in the United States in 1987, and Liu Jiachang said It is said that the divorce was filed in Hong Kong in 2015. The truth needs to be determined by courts in many places and even many countries.

;

;Whose essay should the public believe? This still requires facts as the basis and law as the criterion in order to arrive at a fairer judgment.

;

;The divorce dispute between Liu Jiachang and Zhen Zhen has actually been going on for many years. The reason why old matters have resurfaced is because of the property division disputes arising from the divorce, as well as the huge interest entanglement mixed with the relationship between parent and child. Even an ordinary couple will have similar "Rashomon" problems during divorce disputes, let alone a celebrity couple who need to divide huge amounts of property and have huge conflicts of interest.

;

;Judging from Liu Jiachang's accusations, he is quite resentful of "having his feelings hurt by money" and resentment of "having money hurt because of his feelings." The impression between the lines is that he was originally He is an "old-school face-saving person" who follows the traditional Chinese marriage and family values ​​of "men taking care of the outside and women taking care of the house", but he is exhausted physically and mentally by his wife's deliberate "marriage competition". The reason why their marriage failed was that they fell into a vicious cycle of "talking about feelings hurts money, talking about money hurts feelings". Unclear financial decisions and inadequate marriage and love decisions were also important factors.

;

;Comparing many cases of "peaceful breakup" and "mutual divorce" between celebrity couples, it can be seen that the key to the success of "peaceful breakup" is that both parties have fully completed the notarization of pre-marital property and the division of post-marital property. Procedure, the method of "first being a villain and then being a gentleman" is equivalent to "pursuing common feelings with common interests" rather than "seeking interests in the name of feelings". Before marriage, clarify the distribution of property and custody rights in the event of divorce. In the end, the respective interests of both parties are better protected, and they will not be reduced to online battles with short essays.

;

;It is said that the merger of two well-off houses in first-tier cities is like the merger of two companies, and there will be problems in the distribution of large amounts of property. It is best to divide the property before marriage to effectively avoid possible disputes. In comparison, celebrity marriages involve huge amounts of property. Before getting married, they should agree on how to divide property and child custody rights in the event of a breakup. Otherwise, they will inevitably fall into a "complaint dispute". This time Liu Jiachang and Zhen Zhen were at odds with each other, which once again proved this point.

;For the invention of mRNA vaccine technology, American scientists Katalin Karikó and Drew Wei Drew Weissman won the 2023 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine. The mRNA vaccine has not only saved millions of people around the world from being killed by the new coronavirus, but has also brought tens of billions of dollars in revenue to institutions and scientists engaged in vaccine development and production. This has drawn much attention to RNA, an unstable small nucleic acid molecule. Scientists and medical research and development institutions are working hard to develop new RNA drugs, and circular RNA is expected to become the next generation of blockbuster RNA drugs.

;

;;

;

;Circular RNA therapy is gaining more and more attention. ;(Nature website/picture);

;

;;What is circular RNA;

;

;Each The DNA molecule of a gene generally contains several exon sequences, separated by introns. It must first be transcribed into a single-stranded precursor mRNA. After shearing by shearing enzyme, the intron part is cut out, and then the exon part is cut out. The exons are spliced ​​together to form a functional mRNA, which then binds to the ribosome and guides it to synthesize proteins. Therefore, mRNA is a "reduced version" of the gene's DNA molecule, carrying the complete genetic information of the gene in the most streamlined nucleotides. The reason why mRNA can be used as a vaccine is that it can directly instruct cells to synthesize the corresponding antigen proteins, thereby triggering the body's immune system to produce antibodies to fight the virus.

;

;However, the mRNA vaccine had a bumpy road before encountering the new coronavirus, and it was basically ignored. As a result, Carrico was unable to receive funding, and was transferred, reduced, or even fired from his job many times. Compared with double-stranded DNA molecules of genes, mRNA molecules have a simple structure and are extremely unstable. They generally have a single-stranded linear structure and are easily broken down by RNase. Therefore, the half-life of mRNA in the body is usually only a few hours. Such a short survival time is enough for vaccines, because the mRNA can immediately guide the cells to synthesize antigen proteins after entering the cells. However, for diseases such as cancer, neurological diseases, and genetic diseases that require large amounts of continuous protein treatment, the RNA persists in the body. time is too short.

;

;Interestingly, RNase mainly "bullies" linear RNA, but has no way of attacking circular RNA. In fact, scientists have discovered that there is a kind of RNA in living organisms that can be connected end to end and likes to circle around itself more than 40 years ago. Through the continuous efforts of scientists, this circular RNA has recently begun to show great medical uses.

;

;In 1976, Swiss virologist Daniel Kola Kofsky and a German research team discovered circular RNAs in mouse and plant viruses respectively. Circular forms are present in viruses, but have not attracted enough attention. In the early 1990s, researchers discovered such circular RNA molecules in human and other mammalian cells and proved that these circular RNAs are the transcript products of certain genes. Later, scientists discovered that circular RNA exists in almost all living things. However, compared with linear RNA, most circular RNA splicing is often chaotic and cannot guide cells to synthesize the corresponding proteins. It is also unclear what the purpose of circular RNA is. In the first thirty years after the discovery of circular RNA, , people have always mistaken it as the product of incorrect splicing during gene transcription, so it has not attracted much attention.

;

;With the development of RNA sequencing technology, scientists have discovered that circular RNA is very abundant in mammalian cells, highly conserved, far more stable than linear RNA, and plays many functions, and is not dispensable "junk" . Research shows that more than 60% of human genes can produce both circular and linear transcripts. Currently, more than 100,000 types of circular RNA have been discovered in human cells, which is much higher than the number of known human genes (about 20,000). ). Because it is not susceptible to RNase degradation, in some cells, the half-life of natural circRNA can be 2-4 times that of linear RNA, or even longer, while synthetic circRNA can survive in cells for several days, and The abundance of circular RNA in cells can reach more than 10 times that of linear RNA of related genes. Scientists have also discovered that endogenous circRNAs are involved in a variety of biological functions, including gene transcription, protein translation, immune response, cell proliferation and physiological regulation of tumorigenesis, etc.

;

;Most circular RNAs lack the necessary structure for ribosome recognition and are generally non-coding, that is, they cannot translate proteins. However, there are also a few that are coding RNAs, and these encoded proteins can also function. normal functionality. In 1995, researchers at the University of Colorado Health Science Center realized the coding function of circular RNA in vitro for the first time. Adding an internal ribosome entry site was crucial. This also laid the foundation for the development of circular RNA as vaccines and protein drugs. .

;

;;Technological breakthroughs bring hope;

;

;Since most natural circular RNAs cannot encode proteins and must be artificially designed and synthesized, scientists have Circular RNA technology has undergone a series of improvements and improvements, and has achieved a series of major breakthroughs. For example, in July 2022, the research team of Howard Y. Chang at Stanford University published an important study in the journal Nature Biotechnology. They made a series of improvements to the structure of circular RNA and optimized the translation process. Modules such as the initiation region, termination region, and internal ribosome entry site are implemented, and modular assembly is achieved, making protein translation easier to initiate and more efficient. Compared with unmodified circRNA, the recombinant protein expression level of modified circRNA can be increased hundreds of times. In vivo experiments in mice have shown that circRNA can be maintained in cells for more than 7 days, and only a small amount of circRNA molecules are needed to maintain high protein levels in cells for a longer period of time.

;

;Other major technological breakthroughs include: adding complementary sequences at both ends and in the middle of RNA to allow RNA to automatically form a loop and be more stable; allowing circular RNA to carry longer nucleotide chains, such as more than 12,000 nucleotide dystrophin gene sequence to synthesize more complex proteins; optimize circRNA delivery systems, such as lentivirus or exosome systems, to efficiently deliver circRNA to target cells; use genetic engineering technology Prepare circRNA on a large scale to save a lot of cost and time in circRNA preparation, etc.

;

;In addition to technological improvements, the potential application of circular RNA in the medical field is another research hotspot. In March 2022, Peking University Wei Wensheng's team published a paper in the journal Cell confirming that compared with linear mRNA vaccines, circular RNA vaccines can induce more neutralizing antibodies and more effective T Cellular response. In May 2023, Zhang Yuanhao's team at Stanford University published an article in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences proving that circRNA has the potential to be developed into anti-viral and anti-tumor vaccines. They used circRNA prepared in vitro (can encode viral protein antigens) Immunization of mice induces innate activation of dendritic cells, stimulating robust antigen-specific CD8 T cell responses in lymph nodes and tissues. Immunity experiments in mice showed that circular RNA designed for melanoma could significantly inhibit tumor growth in mice compared with untreated mice. This indicates that circRNA can be used as a therapeutic vaccine to induce strong cellular immunity and eliminate tumors.

;

;Compared with linear mRNA products, circular RNA products have several major advantages. First, circular RNA is more stable and easier to store than linear mRNA. This is because of its structural characteristics, linear mRNA is easy to transport It is degraded by RNase during storage, delivery, etc., so it must be cryopreserved and cold-chain transported. Even if linear mRNA is subjected to a series of modifications such as nucleotide modification, the cost and effect are still not ideal, while circular RNA can be It can be stored at room temperature for about a month and can be frozen and thawed repeatedly. Secondly, circRNA is safer than linear RNA. Research shows that natural circRNA molecules show lower immunogenicity and cytotoxicity. Thirdly, circRNA is safer than linear RNA. RNA-like RNA has the ability to produce prolonged antigens and can induce a long-lasting immune response in the body, thus promoting the production of more antibodies and longer-lasting immune protection.

;

;Therefore, circRNA products are expected to become a better choice in the field of RNA therapy for various refractory diseases such as viral infections, tumors, pathogenic bacterial infections, autoimmune diseases, metabolic diseases, etc. play a greater role in disease prevention and treatment.

;

;;Has received huge investments;

;

;Inspired by the great success of mRNA vaccines, some scientists around the world who are engaged in pioneering research on circRNA have also established a number of A circular RNA company was founded, and it quickly became favored and sought after by capital. Some biopharmaceutical giants have also joined the trend of developing circular RNA pharmaceutical products, hoping to take the initiative in future competition.

;

;Daniel Anderson of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) and others founded Orna Therapeutics in 2019. The company’s pipeline products mainly include anti-tumor and anti-infection drugs. and circular RNA therapies for the treatment of genetic diseases, but they are all in the early stages of development. The company plans to launch the first clinical trial in 2024. In February 2021 and August 2022, Orna completed Series A and Series B financing of US$80 million and US$220 million respectively. Merck, a pharmaceutical giant with a history of 130 years, seems to be very optimistic about this startup. It has paid an advance payment of US$150 million and plans to jointly develop circular RNA therapies for infectious diseases with Orna Company, while injecting US$100 million to participate. Received Orna’s Series B financing.

;

;Laronde was founded by Flagship Pioneering with an investment of US$50 million on May 11, 2021. It received US$440 million in financing three months later, making it the largest environmental investment company so far. This is the largest financing ever received by an RNA company. Since the flagship Pioneer Company once incubated the RNA vaccine star company Moderna of the United States, Lloyd's Company is also known as "Modena 2.0". After receiving huge financing, the company is focusing on preventive and therapeutic circular RNA product development and clinical trials. However, on June 12, 2023, a joint investigation report released by the Boston Globe and STAT showed that the company was suspected of falsifying preclinical experimental data. For example, the circular RNA it developed for weight loss drugs only worked in mice. Expression, but not in monkeys. In a subsequent statement, the company also admitted the data fraud designed in the above report and dealt with the relevant responsible persons.

;

;Yuanhao Zhang of MIT founded Orbital Therapeutics in September 2022 with Drew Weisman, pioneer of mRNA vaccine technology and winner of the 2023 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, and others. ) company, which completed a Series A financing of up to US$270 million in April 2023.

;

;China also has a number of start-up companies developing circRNA drugs. Circode Bio was founded in September 2018 by researcher Wang Zefeng of the Max Planck Institute of Computing Technology of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and others. It is the world's first start-up company to develop nucleic acid drugs based on circular RNA. In December 2021, Huanma Biotech completed Pre-A round financing of more than 20 million US dollars, and in August 2023, it completed another tens of millions of US dollars in Series A financing. At present, the company has reached a research and development cooperation agreement with the American pharmaceutical giant Pfizer to jointly develop circular RNA therapies. Yuanyin Biotech was founded by Professor Wei Wensheng of Peking University and others in April 2021. In June 2022, it successfully completed a Series A financing of more than 280 million yuan. Together with the angel round and Pre-A round of financing, the company has accumulated more than 400 million yuan. The company's R&D pipeline includes circRNA products for the treatment of infectious diseases, metabolic diseases and tumors. Among them, the fastest-growing product is the circRNA COVID-19 vaccine, which has completed preclinical trials and entered clinical trials. However, due to the global COVID-19 The epidemic has calmed down, and it is expected that the development of the new crown vaccine may be shelved.

;

;However, overall, the current research on circRNA therapy has just begun. To achieve what one start-up company predicts, circRNA will start a revolution or achieve 100 therapeutic goals within ten years. The promise of a new drug project still has a long way to go.

;Recently, Chinese medicinal materials grown by a farmer in Huaiyang District, Zhoukou City, Henan Province were robbed by local villagers, once again causing Internet extremes Big attention. Not long ago, there was an incident of villagers robbing corn in the city. On a wider scale, such incidents of theft and robbery of large growers are common on the Internet. This is closely related to the fact that the place where the incident occurred deliberately downplayed the illegal nature of the villagers' looting and condoned the villagers' infringement of the rights and interests of agricultural investors.

;

;After the robbery of Chinese medicinal materials in Zhoukou attracted attention, the Huaiyang District Agriculture and Rural Affairs Bureau issued a situation report on November 1, saying that the incident was not a robbery, but the villagers "mistakenly believed" that the growers had harvested for the second time. After finishing, he went into the field to pick up medicinal materials. The growers called the police after trying to dissuade them to no avail. The police quickly arrived at the scene and "persuaded" the people to leave. The report also said that after the second harvest of medicinal materials is completed, it is "a habit for many years" for growers to allow villagers to pick up leftover medicinal materials in the fields.

;

;"Pick up", "years of habit" and "mistake" are clichés. They can be seen in almost every incident where growers are robbed. Half a month ago, after the corn robbery incident in Dancheng County, Zhoukou City, the local Agriculture and Rural Affairs Bureau responded that "people went to harvested plots to pick up corn."

;

;These excuses are really ridiculous. Even if there is a local habit of "picking up", even if the growers allow the villagers to pick up after the second harvest is completed, the growers have repeatedly blocked the looting. If the farmers turn a blind eye and don't hear, is this still "allowed" by the growers? Is this still legal "picking"? In the Dancheng County corn robbery incident, hundreds of villagers also ignored the growers' obstruction and ran to the unharvested plots in front of the harvesters to "pick up" them, forcing the harvesters to stop working to avoid accidental injuries. Is this still traditional "picking up"?

;

;In the case of Gushi County public officials driving patrol cars to steal sorghum, the growers had not yet harvested the sorghum. This cannot be excused by "picking up", right? But in the eyes of some local people, cutting a few ears of sorghum is not a big deal. "Rural people just like to take advantage of it." Patrols are arranged to avoid safety accidents, not to stop theft.

;

;When local officials faced the looting incident, they not only downplayed it in words and justified large-scale looting, but also in action. Whether it was the robbery of Chinese medicinal materials in Huaiyang or the robbery of corn in Dancheng, after the growers called the police and reported it to the government, the police only came to the scene to "maintain order" and "persuade" the villagers to leave. What order should be maintained? Do we still need the police to maintain order and escort during looting?

;

;How to characterize looting behavior? Article 268 of the Criminal Law stipulates that if a crowd is gathered to rob public or private property, the amount is relatively large or there are other serious circumstances, the ringleaders and active participants shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not more than three years, criminal detention or surveillance, and shall also be fined; if the amount is huge or there are other special circumstances, If the circumstances are serious, the offender shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than three years but not more than ten years, and shall also be fined. The standards for relatively large amounts and huge amounts shall be determined by each high court. According to the standards of the Shanghai High Court, robbery of property worth more than 4,000 yuan is considered a "large amount", and more than 40,000 yuan is a "huge amount."

;

;聚众哄抢财物罪只处罚首要分子和积极参加的，对一般参加的，如果不能定罪，还可以进行行政处罚。治安管理处罚法规定，哄抢公私财物的，处五日以上十日以下拘留，可以并处五百元以下罚款；情节较重的，处十日以上十五日以下拘留，可以并处一千元以下罚款。对那些并非哄抢而是盗窃的，可以适用刑法和治安管理处罚法对盗窃行为的规定。

;

;但现实中，警方往往对这些哄抢盗窃行为网开一面。几年前发生在浙江的瓜农三万斤西瓜一夜之间被偷光事件，警方在调查之后，却认定摘瓜者是误信了“种瓜老板不要了”的谣言才去摘瓜，没有盗窃的主观故意，认定不构成盗窃，只是“民事纠纷”，要求种瓜农户走民事程序索赔。陕西西安一瓜农种植的西瓜也曾被村民哄抢，村支部书记的说辞也是村民“听信了谣言”。

;

;如果“听信谣言”能成为脱罪的理由，那就没有违法犯罪了。想要偷抢东西了，就去散布点“谣言”，然后就可以大摇大摆地去偷去抢。天底下有这样荒唐的事吗？

;

;还有一些人以当地农民年老无依、生活无着等为村民辩护。这些理由也是站不住脚的。即便自身生活遭遇困境，那也应该去找政府反映问题，而不是哄抢别人的财产。事实上，这些辩解也完全是想象出来的借口，参与哄抢的村民，绝大多数没有到生活无着的地步。

;

;近年来不少地方类似的哄抢、盗窃事件频发，不能不说与地方政府、当地警方的包庇开脱和纵容有关。事件发生后，当地政府只是“劝导”参与哄抢者交回哄抢的财物，而不对其进行处罚，甚至有些人拒不交回也没什么事。那哄抢者当然不会罢手，下次还会继续抢，而且不会再交回了。相反，如果一次事件后，有关部门果断处罚，该拘留的拘留，该判刑的判刑，杀鸡儆猴，以后还有人敢抢吗？

;

;2014年，福建漳州也发生过外地养鱼户的鱼被当地村民哄抢的事，当地警方及时立案，对参与抢鱼情节比较严重的三名村民予以拘留，并敦促其他参与的村民“投案”，“退回赃物”。明确宣布哄抢是违法行为，要受到法律处罚，抢到的东西是“赃物”，必须退还，这才是针对此类哄抢的正确处理方式。也只有这样，才能建立和维护当地良好的营商环境，吸引更多的农业投资，振兴乡村。

; Sat, 04 Nov 2023 15:25:06 +0800 秋季以来持续偏暖影响几何？会是暖冬吗？http://www.infzm.com/contents/259961
;;2023-11-04 14:00:00;
;

;Since this autumn, temperatures have continued to be high in most parts of my country, and winter has been delayed in many places. Many members of the public have questions: Will this year be a mild winter?

;

;At a press conference held by the China Meteorological Administration on the 3rd, Jia Xiaolong, deputy director of the National Climate Center, introduced that the national average temperature in October was 12.2°C, 1.6°C higher than the same period in normal years, and the highest temperature in the same period since 1961. Highest. Most of Northeast China, most of Shandong, most of Inner Mongolia, most of Xinjiang and other places were 2°C to 4°C higher. The temperatures in Inner Mongolia, Xinjiang, Tianjin and Liaoning were all the highest for the same period in history. The daily highest temperatures at 140 national weather stations exceeded October’s historical extreme value.

;

;"Since this autumn, the mid-to-high latitudes of Eurasia have been dominated by zonal circulation. my country has been controlled by positive anomalies in the height field. The intensity of the Siberian High has been generally weak, and cold air activity has been weak, resulting in persistent temperatures in most parts of my country. It’s on the high side,” Jia Xiaolong said.

;

;Experts said that high temperatures and weak cold air will have a certain impact on the development of fog and haze weather and agricultural production.

;

;Recently, fog and haze weather has occurred in Huanghuai and other places in North China. Zhang Jiancheng, deputy director of the National Meteorological Center, analyzed that the main reason is that the zonal circulation has been dominated over North China recently and the cold air is weak. North China, Huanghuai and other places are located in the weak pressure field behind the high pressure, and southerly winds have prevailed for a long time. At the same time, accompanied by high humidity atmosphere, vertical temperature inversion structure and special topographic effects of the Taihang Mountains and Yanshan Mountains, the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei region has continued to Severe fog and haze weather.

;

;Although winter has already begun in most of Northeast China, northwestern North China, and most of northwest China, the onset of winter in most of the above-mentioned areas is later than normal, and in some areas it is more than 5 days later.

;

;Jia Xiaolong said that warm and hot weather may lead to low soil moisture, affecting crop emergence and growth, which is not conducive to spring plowing and sowing in the coming year; delaying winter may affect crop growth seasons and cycles, which is not conducive to agricultural production plans and Yield; warm and hot climates can easily lead to excessive growth of crops and are conducive to the overwintering and reproduction of pests and diseases. Severe winter rain and snow disasters and increased risks of pests and diseases in the coming year.

;

;Does the continued warmness mean that this year will be a mild winter? What impact will El Niño have on the climate this winter?

;

;The National Climate Center issued a climate prediction bulletin on the 3rd, stating that the temperature in most parts of my country this winter will be close to or higher than normal for the same period of the year. The temperature has obvious phase characteristics, with the first winter being warmer and the latter winter close to normal.

;

;“Whether it is a warm winter depends on whether the temperature can reach the warm winter standard.” Jia Xiaolong said.

;

;Monitoring shows that the equatorial central and eastern Pacific Ocean has entered an El Niño state, and an El Niño event is about to form. Affected by this, abnormal anticyclonic circulation prevails in the lower troposphere over the northwest Pacific and South China Sea in winter, the East Asian trough is weak, the East Asian winter monsoon is weak, and temperatures in most central and eastern my country are higher than normal for the same period.

;

;On the other hand, the abnormal anticyclonic circulation is conducive to the transport of warm and moist water vapor from the tropics to the south of my country. In conjunction with the movement of cold air southward, it is easy to cause excessive precipitation in the southern region.

;

;"Statistics show that in the context of El Niño events, winter temperatures fluctuate greatly, and the number of cold air events that affect our country is often high. It is recommended to pay close attention to the possible adverse effects of periodic low-temperature rain and snow weather processes." Jia Xiaolong said.

; Sat, 04 Nov 2023 14:25:04 +0800 贫困大学生哭诉助学金被挤占：福利如何才能落到需要的人手里？丨快评http://www.infzm.com/contents/259963
;;2023-11-04 13:00:00;
;

;Recently, a video of poor college students crying about being squeezed out of their scholarship qualifications has been widely circulated on social networks. attracted great attention. Tianjin Sino-German University of Applied Sciences, which was involved in the incident, said on November 2 that it had set up a special work team to conduct investigation and verification as soon as possible. The subsequent investigation results will be handled in accordance with regulations and announced in a timely manner.

;

;In the video posted online, a boy said that his father died and his mother married when he was young, and his grandfather also passed away when he was 18 years old. Now he only has his grandma as a relative. Their family is registered locally. poor households. After entering college, he received national scholarships in previous years, but this year, the class held a scholarship qualification selection, and he was not selected. The students who were selected were wearing real AJ sneakers (a sneaker brand owned by Nike, the price Not cheap), using Apple 14 Pro Max mobile phone and iPad Pro tablet, often having dinner parties and traveling. He reported the situation to the counselor, but was forced to move out of the dormitory.

;

;If this is true, it is really outrageous, and this video has attracted a lot of attention.

;

;In reality, fraud in scholarship applications is nothing new in some colleges and universities. National scholarships for colleges and universities are financial aid provided by the state finance to college students with financial difficulties. They are mainly used to meet the living expenses of students. The average aid standard is 3,000 yuan per person per year (not equal, can be divided into 2-3 levels), about 20% students may receive financial aid. Bursaries are a benefit provided by the state to some poor college students. Since it is welfare, how to distribute it and how to let people who really need it get this money is a very important issue.

;

;According to this student, the scholarship qualifications for his class were selected by the whole class because he was not satisfied with the results of the first selection and went to the teacher to report it. As a result, he came last in the second selection. , became the person least qualified to receive scholarships in the class. The whole class selection seems very "reasonable", but when used here, it is undoubtedly very absurd.

;

;Who is in financial difficulty and who is not is not a matter decided by one person and one vote. If the selection is held, it will become a "connection" competition, and it is inevitable that some students will form gangs and even bribe the vote. As for truly poor students, they may not be able to mingle with better-off classmates due to financial constraints, and as a result, they may not be eligible for financial aid. On social networks, it is not uncommon for a group of people to "unite together" to promote one person to receive a scholarship and treat them to dinner, and then another person will take turns to receive it next time. Such posts are not uncommon. As a result, some colleges and universities have issued notices that award-winning students are not allowed to use their scholarships to treat guests, otherwise their qualifications for future assessments will be cancelled.

;

;Some schools and classes even ask students applying for financial aid to tell their situations in front of the whole class and "campaign" for financial aid. This is letting people show their scars for others to see, which may cause a huge blow to the students' self-esteem. Although some students are poor, they do not want others to know, especially in public. After all, poverty is not something worth showing off, and not everyone is compassionate. It is common for students to laugh at poor students in school.

;

;It is also not a good idea to let counselors, class teachers, etc. have the decision-making power about scholarship eligibility. First of all, it is difficult to ensure that these people are completely public-minded in the quota allocation process. Maybe most counselors are fair, but it is inevitable that there will be a few who are partial. Sometimes, financial aid eligibility may even become a tool to blackmail students into "obedience." Secondly, counselors and others may not be able to fully understand the students' financial situation, and lack sufficient and correct information to make correct judgments.

;

;There should be some objective criteria for determining scholarship qualifications, rather than just subjective determination, whether it is the subjectivity of an individual person (identification by the counselor or class teacher) or the subjectivity of the entire class (selection by the whole class) .

;

;What is the objective standard? Theoretically, it can be whether the student's family income is below a certain standard. However, schools cannot directly obtain the income and assets of students' families, so many schools ask poor students to provide poverty certificates from village committees or neighborhood committees. But these proofs are not entirely credible. For one, these proofs of poverty are not necessarily true. Especially for many rural areas, when village students are admitted to college, even if their families are not particularly poor, it is not difficult to go to the village committee to issue a poverty certificate. After all, they are all fellow villagers, and a certificate can alleviate the family's financial burden. Many village cadres will cover the burden unless the family's income is significantly higher than the village average. Secondly, the poverty standards in different regions are also different. Poverty in economically developed regions and poverty in western regions are completely different concepts. In recent years, there have been frequent cases of government officials visiting "poor" people and being criticized. Although some of them are falsely poor, there are also some misunderstandings caused by differences in regional economic levels. Therefore, the family poverty certificate issued by the place of origin can only be a reference and should not be used as a deciding factor.

;

;How should the scholarship qualifications be determined? This is of course a very complex issue and difficult to achieve completely ideally. But there are still some standards that can be referenced. For example, applying for a student loan can be a necessary condition. In the national student aid policy system, student loans are mainly used to solve the tuition and accommodation fees problems of students with financial difficulties. Nowadays, the tuition and accommodation fees of most schools are much higher than the scholarship standards. If you can pay for tuition and accommodation by yourself, it means you are not too poor. Otherwise, you can apply for a student loan to pay tuition and keep your own money for living expenses.

;

;You can also observe students’ consumption on campus. The approach of Nanjing University of Science and Technology is a good reference. In 2016, Nanjing University of Science and Technology analyzed student consumption data in the cafeteria and listed those students who ate more than 60 meals in the cafeteria per month with a total consumption of no more than 420 yuan as aid recipients, and paid money directly to their meal cards. This is a very smart approach. As we all know, food in school cafeterias is much cheaper than outside. If a student eats almost every meal in the school cafeteria and the average consumption per meal is not high, there is a high probability that he is a poor student. Rich students either eat less in the on-campus cafeteria and often eat out and order takeout, or they spend more in the cafeteria and eat well. Eating is a basic necessity for people, whether rich or poor, everyone needs to eat, so using food consumption level as a measurement standard can cover all students. And the level of food consumption is difficult to fake. It is difficult for a person who is accustomed to a high standard of diet to continue to lower his dietary standards for a few months if the economic conditions do not change. Of course, this approach may also be used opportunistically, eating a little in the cafeteria for each meal, and then going out to eat and drink, but I am afraid that there are not many rich people who can persist in this way.

;

;In short, as a welfare provided by the national finance to poor students, the national scholarship should be used wisely to truly reduce the burden of life for poor students, and should not become Tang Monk meat that everyone wants to eat. Tianjin Sino-German University of Applied Sciences officially stated that it has launched an investigation and hopes that the investigation and handling results will be fair and just. More importantly, the problem of unfair distribution of scholarships occurs in many colleges and universities, and should arouse the vigilance of all colleges and universities.

;

; Sat, 04 Nov 2023 13:25:04 +0800 当一个盲人想要登上珠峰http://www.infzm.com/contents/259956
;;2023-11-04 12:00:00;
;

;;

;

;During the climb, there were crisscrossing and completely irregular ice cracks underfoot. Zhang Hong You need to use trekking poles to test the location and terrain first, then use your feet to measure the approximate width of the crevasse, and finally dare to step out. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;Standing on the top of the world's highest peak, blind man Zhang Hong's first thought was " Get down quickly."

;

;“Most of the mountaineering accidents occur on the way down the mountain.” Zhang Hong said that when climbing, a person’s center of gravity is first. Even if he falls, the mountain will block him. When going down the mountain, “it all depends on the subconscious mind.” . He felt at ease until he returned to Everest Base Camp and took off his crampons - which meant that danger was truly far away. Sherpa (note: local people living on both sides of the Himalayas, usually serving as guides) gave him a cup of milk tea and a few biscuits to satisfy his hunger. The climb to the summit and back nearly exhausted his strength, and he nearly fell into coma.

;

;Two years later, the cognitive system composed of sound, hearing and touch makes his memories of the world’s highest peak still vivid. He clearly felt the difference in wind at different altitudes: the wind from the glaciers at low altitudes was mixed with freezing cold air, the storms at high altitudes made loud noises, and the strong winds picked up snow particles, ice slag and small rocks, giving people a sticky feel. , like a high wall that is insurmountable.

;

;Hiking across the glacier, the ice on the soles of your feet has a hard texture, and there is a "click" sound like biting potato chips when you step on it. Even with crampons, the risk of slipping is unavoidable. The snow is thick, and the sound of footsteps is muffled in it, giving people a more solid feeling.

;

;On May 24, 2021, at the 8848.86-meter summit of Mount Everest, Zhang Hong followed the example of his predecessors and left several photos and a 15-second short video. The former became his WeChat avatar, and the latter was the certificate of his record as "the first blind man in Asia to climb Mount Everest".

;

;When the news of the successful summit reached Fan Lixin’s base camp, the documentary director had mixed emotions.

;

;He was happy that Zhang Hong’s years of hard work had paid off. In 2019, he heard about Zhang Hong's ambition from a mountaineering friend: a blind masseur eager to climb Mount Everest. Everyone around him thought it was unreliable, but Fan Lixin became curious about this character. Like a gambler, he wanted to film this story that was very likely to fail. In May 2020, the documentary was launched, and the fate of the two "paranoid" people intersected since then.

;

;What is worrying is that due to an oxygen problem, the two accompanying photographers were not able to go up together. The video footage of Zhang Hong’s summit was blank. Fan Lixin cried out that she collapsed, “It’s hard for a clever woman to make a meal without rice.” On October 27, 2023, the documentary "The Invisible Peak" was released nationwide. Fan Lixin filled the gap in the material with a "black" segment.

;

;"We shot more than 360 hours of material, and it took a year to edit. When editing, I was thinking, if there is no material for this section, why not use a black field and an immersive (Sound experience), immersing the audience into the world of a blind person." Fan Lixin told Southern Weekend reporters, "Use this black field to take the audience to the top of the world, following Zhang Hong's footsteps."

; < p>;;

;

;Zhang Hong and his wife Xia Qiong. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;Zhang Hong has an almost paranoid desire to climb Mount Everest. At that time, he was working as the deputy director of the Traditional Chinese Medicine Department of a hospital in Tibet. He was in his forties, had a stable job, worked with his wife, and had a son. Everyone was puzzled by his "crazy" desire to climb Mount Everest: "This thing is completely unreliable. I have such a good job in my hand, and I have stabilized, and I still want to do this. This is full." I can hold on."

;

;Zhang Hong admitted that obsession comes from a certain desire to prove something. "I used to label myself as an unfortunate person in society. But the process of climbing Mount Everest taught me one thing: In fact, I am the same as everyone else, and society and nature have no regard for me. I don’t look at it differently.”

;

;;“Mount Everest will not give me more sympathy just because I am blind”;

;

;Official filming of the summit Fan Lixin followed Zhang Hong for more than a year. At that time, Zhang Hong's biggest anxiety during his trip to Mount Everest was money. When the documentary was launched, Zhang Hong received support of US$5,000 from a foundation, but there was still a big gap between the "small one million" RMB. In front of the camera, Zhang Hong took advantage of the wine and asked his brother in embarrassment.

;

;"I didn't know much about it at the time. To be honest, I was quite anxious. If he couldn't raise the money, he wouldn't be able to go even if he wanted to," Fan Lixin told a reporter from Southern Weekend. "It's possible that he would become a The story of 'Don Quixote.'" Later, through crowdfunding, brand intervention, and hospital support, Zhang Hong was able to scrape together the money one week before departure.

;

;Zhang Hong took the traditional route to climb Mount Everest. Take a helicopter or small fixed-wing plane from Kathmandu, the capital of Nepal, to the small town of Lukla, and then hike for 7 days to the Everest base camp, which is "equivalent to initial adaptive training." After a short rest at the base camp, the team conducted two training sessions. The destination of the first training session is Lobuche, which is more than 6,100 meters high; the second training session involves climbing to the C3 camp at an altitude of 8,300 meters.

;

;Fan Lixin has never climbed a mountain before, and Luo Buche, who was training for the first time, was the first mountain he had climbed. When he was a child, he had an operation on his leg and one-third of his knee was cut off, making it difficult for him to climb Mount Everest with Zhang Hong. He invited two mountain photographers, including the producer who also served as a sound engineer, and the team was streamlined to only four people.

;

;Climbing from the base camp to the C1 camp, the altitude does not increase much, but you have to pass through the Khumbu Glacier, which is known as the "terrible glacier". There are trenches in the glacier. In the wide ice ravine, two ladders were stacked together to form a bridge, and people and cameras trembled across it. Even Sherpas who have competed with Mount Everest all year round cannot take it lightly. During the filming of the documentary, a Sherpa fell into an ice ravine and hung on by a thread. After the people in the same team worked hard to rescue him, his body was curled up and his ears were purple from the cold.

;

;Climbers with normal vision can take one step and look at ten steps, but Zhang Hong can only stare at the current step. Every step is difficult. With every step he took, he silently recited in his heart: "This snowfield accepted me again, and the footprints under my feet carried me again."

;

;;

;

;When shooting on Mount Everest, the biggest difficulty was the electricity , because the diesel generator needs to come up little by little and can only be charged by solar energy. However, the sun is often not seen for three to five days when climbing, and the documentary team often feels anxious. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;“Everest will not give me more sympathy just because I am blind. There is an ice cave under the glacier, and there is a cliff next to it. The ladder is also shaky, and the difficulty will not be reduced just because I can't see it." Zhang Hong was hit by a similar feeling when he climbed the mountain for the first time, "I can feel that I and Everyone is the same, doing one thing in an equal and fair environment, there is no barrier between me and everyone, instead of before I thought that I was an unfortunate and alternative existence."

;

;However, due to the inability to see, ice climbing poses many obstacles to Zhang Hong. Fan Lixin said that the weather in the Himalayas was bad that year and the road conditions were complicated. When climbing an ice wall, sighted climbers can step on the ice pits that have been stepped on by the person in front of them. But Zhang Hong couldn't see it. The steel crampons under his feet were difficult to accurately kick into the old pit, and it took more effort than ordinary people to kick out the new pit. When hanging on the ice wall, the climber relies on three points of support, pulling the rope with one hand and smashing the ice with an ice ax with the other hand to pull his body upwards.

;

;"We can see it, so we probably know where to hit it, and it will get more force. But he can't see it, so he just chisels randomly. If he chisels once, the ice will fly away and the chisel will be in vain, so he has to chisel again. Climbing an ice wall of more than ten meters is very tiring." Fan Lixin observed.

;

;During the first training session, Zhang Hong suddenly lost his temper and said he no longer wanted to climb, and asked for a helicopter to be sent to pick him up. Some people in the team felt that his pace could not keep up with the progress and slowed down the progress. Zhang Hong looked displeased. "He needs to get in touch with the team. He will feel that the risk is too high. He is not afraid that something will happen to him. What he is most afraid of is that he has not really climbed yet, and he is injured just in training, or his physical strength Exhausted." Fan Lixin told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;“Above five or six thousand meters above sea level, people’s emotions and thinking are completely different from those in the plains.” Zhang Hong analyzed his mentality at the time, “If you haven’t climbed (officially) yet, it’s better to practice. It’s not worth it if you get injured during the training.”

;

;During the second training session, Zhang Hong suffered from an attack of cholecystitis, which caused his facial features to twist tightly together in pain. Back at base camp, the camp doctor examined him. Zhang Hong learned from others that the doctor recommended sending him back to Kathmandu for treatment, "even requiring surgery."

;

;“Once I went to treatment, the climb almost came to a standstill.” Zhang Hong wrapped himself in a sleeping bag and broke down crying. "Time waits for no one, the weather is bad, and the window period is limited, only a few days. You can't give up climbing just because of this."

;

;He blamed himself for not having a plan for this, but he was also optimistic about it. There is nothing that can be done about the pain, except rubbing the abdomen and massaging the liver and gallbladder meridian. One of the reasons why he climbed Mount Everest was to break the outside world's stereotype of blind people. Blind people can not only do massage. But as fate would have it, after two or three days of massage, the symptoms were really relieved.

;

;"Everything is God's will." He said.

;

;;

;

;On May 24, 2021, Zhang Hong, who has been blind for 25 years, successfully climbed the world's highest peak, Mount Everest, from the Nepalese side, becoming the first blind person in Asia to climb Mount Everest. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;;To the summit;

;

;The moment of reaching the summit Come on May 23, 2021 at 7pm. Zhang Hong, the Chinese guide, photographer and Sherpa set off from the C4 camp to the top of Mount Everest. When we were only 100 meters away from the peak, something unexpected happened.

;

;The bad weather froze everyone's oxygen regulator valves, causing oxygen leaks. Taken together, the current amount of oxygen cannot support everyone reaching the summit. Qiangzi is Zhang Hong's Chinese guide. He has 15 years of experience as a mountain guide, but has never climbed Mount Everest. For mountaineers, the 100 meters that can be climbed in 2 hours is a "huge temptation."

;

;Hadron finally decided to give up his oxygen, and the two photographers made the same decision. The three of them descended, and Sherpa accompanied Zhang Hong to the summit alone.

;

;Fan Lixin later asked about the reason for giving up. Qiangzi said that in the three or four years he had known Zhang Hong, he had witnessed his difficulties and grievances along the way. "I really don't want him to leave again. Maybe he will never have a second chance to leave again in this life. Training, raising money, withstanding the public opinion of the surrounding society, and the doubts of relatives and friends - you see No, why are you taking such a big risk? No one would think that a blind person also has the right to realize his own ideals, pursue his own value in life, and at the same time give his family a voice."

;

;Three Summers Erba and Zhang Hong were connected on a rope, and Zhang Hong pushed the ascender forward. A Sherpa led the way about 1.5 meters in front. The two of them did not understand the language and only relied on simple English words "go", "up" and "down" to communicate. There were two Sherpas carrying oxygen behind him, and one of them occasionally patted his legs to "express comfort and encouragement."

;

;Before climbing to the top, the most difficult section is the "Hillary Steps", which is a blade-shaped ridge with almost vertical rock walls that "cannot even catch snow". Zhang Hong estimated that the narrow spot is only about 30 centimeters, which can only accommodate half a foot.

;

;The hands became his eyes at this time. He supported it with one hand, and used the other hand to explore the way forward along the tip of his toes. After finding the foothold for the next step, he used the other hand to find the support point. Every time he took a step, he "had to stop and rest for a long time." Zhang Hong said that climbing the Hillary Step was like walking through the artificial rockery he had seen when his eyesight was still intact. The stone gaps were completely irregular and "I didn't know what to do next."

;

;The "Hillary Steps" are only 12 meters from the peak, but it took Zhang Hong more than two hours. When climbing, he lost the concept of time for a while. He would swing the rope left and right at intervals and ask the Sherpa who was leading the way: "How long? How long?" Sherpa's answer was half an hour every time.

;

;"The results haven't arrived after several and a half hours. Maybe I asked how long it would be after 5 minutes, and then asked again after 10 minutes." Zhang Hong was a little anxious and said several times. No,” “I’m going to die,” “I’m going down.” At first Sherpa ignored his complaints, but the last time Sherpa was also angry. He emotionally agreed to Zhang Hong's request to give up, and turned around to help him remove the ascender and replace it with the descender.

;

;;

;

;Fan Lixin recalled that there were two or three major cyclones in the Indian Ocean that year, which caused heavy snow and strong winds on Mount Everest. On the day Zhang Hong reached the summit, the wind speed reached 60 kilometers per hour, and people were almost killed. If it blows down, if the clothes are scratched and the down flies off, the consequence will be "instant hypothermia and death." ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;Unwillingness gripped Zhang Hong, and he said to Sherpa: "Go ! Go! Go! ""Keep walking."

;

;While crawling, Zhang Hong suddenly felt his crampons stepping on a soft snow. The further he walked, the thicker the snow became. Until the snow is deep enough to cover the entire sole of the foot. He suddenly bumped into the backpack of the person in front of him. "You summit." He heard the leading Sherpa turn his head and say to him.

;

;“I didn’t think I had really reached the top.” Zhang Hong recalled, “I didn’t know where I was going, but I just walked like this. Maybe I was too tired and couldn’t take a step from He can react with his concentration."

;

;His senses captured the changes in the surrounding environment before his consciousness.

;

;While going up the mountain, Zhang Hong invisibly felt that the mountain he was climbing was like a huge obstacle blocking his face. But in that moment, the barrier disappeared. He could hear the surroundings becoming empty, the kind of emptiness that was unobstructed. He turned his head to the left, then to the right, and listened carefully to the sounds around him. The sound of wind swirling violently on his head made his hair stand on end.

;

;They didn’t stay on the top of Mount Everest for a long time. Zhang Hong heard Sherpa say, “Photo, photo,” and quickly took a few photos. It wasn’t until they got down the mountain that they found out, and even took photos for certification. video. He later told Fan Lixin that he only heard various incomprehensible languages ​​blaring on the intercom.

;

;"When he thought about that moment, it was even a little ridiculous. He had prepared for so many years, prepared many postures and rhetoric to say on Mount Everest, but nothing, just 2 seconds, he He woke up and said, hurry down, this place is too scary, like hell, the howling of the wind." Fan Lixin recalled, "When he was blind before, he really felt that the world was collapsing, just like in hell. He said that I I have been climbing for 20 years, climbing from hell to flat ground, and then from flat ground to the top of Mount Everest. (When I reached the summit) I felt as if I was in hell again, so I hurried down the mountain."

;

;End of the climb Later, they were trapped in Nepal by a new wave of COVID-19. At that time, it was the most noisy time outside. Fan Lixin counted that more than 70 international mainstream media, including the BBC and AFP, were reporting on him. Zhang Hong said that he was not immersed in the feeling of being under the spotlight at the time.

;

;"After he climbed Mount Everest, he discovered that climbing Mount Everest was not the highlight moment he needed at all, but made him understand that the current step is the most important. Because this step has not been stepped on Well, you may just fall and you will be dead. There is no so-called highlight moment at all. The real highlight moment may just begin when you are in the most dangerous moment. The guide in the movie also said: Climbing to the top is not the end. Returning to the top is not the end. Home is the end." When he was in Nepal, Fan Lixin chatted with him, "He said, now you tell me that where I am standing is the top of Mount Everest, and I believe it because I can't see it."

;

;;He wanted others to think that blind people can not only be masseurs;

;

;When he first started filming Zhang Hong, Fan Lixin felt that he was a somewhat impatient person, debugging equipment or Zhang Hong would look a little anxious when it was time to replace the battery.

;

;The impatience comes from his sudden blindness. At the age of 21, he suffered a glaucoma attack and permanently lost his vision. It took three or four years for Zhang Hong to try to accept being unable to see, and his personality changed as a result. He became "emotionally broken" and "bad-tempered". He failed to get what he wanted, or accidentally knocked over a cup. They will show their impatient side.

;

;My wife Xia Qiong captured these moments softly. She once tried to put herself in her husband's shoes, shut herself in the room, turned off all the lights, and closed the windows tightly. "It felt like the four walls were squeezing in on you." She realized her husband's nervousness about danger in an unknown environment. "It was originally a very docile sheep, a free species, but suddenly it was trapped in an invisible black cage."

;

;The environment in which Zhang Hong grew up as a child was closely linked to "blindness". His father and uncle are both blind. He, who has good vision, sometimes acts as a "blind stick". The three of them pull a bamboo pole, and Zhang Hong leads the way. On a rainy day, the road was slippery and Zhang Hong fell, taking his father and uncle with him. In rural society, he had long been aware of the plight of blind people.

;

;“I have known their lives since I was a child, and I cannot accept the thought that I will have to live in such an environment in the future.” Zhang Hong said.

;

;Xia Qiong noticed that family background and childhood memories created a self-defense mechanism in Zhang Hong's heart. Before getting married, Zhang Hong had never taken the initiative to talk to her about his father and uncle. They got acquainted with Zhang Hong when he could still see the world. Later, Zhang Hong lost his sight. She joked that she was "harmed" by Jin Yong's martial arts novels. She bravely felt that "he should not be left alone with no one." Tube". In 1999, the two people, who had been in love for three years, decided to testify.

;

;The family elders unanimously opposed it, and his father cried in front of Xia Qiong. Zhang Hong promised her: "I will definitely make your family look at you with admiration." She thought that maybe it was from that time that he laid the groundwork for her husband's "constant tossing" in the future.

;

;In the two decades before Tibet settled down, Xia Qiong described their life as "precarious." Zhang Hong studied massage in school, but he was not obsessed with it. After he lost his sight, professionalism actually saved him from being unable to eat. Xia Qiong also learned massage. The couple first worked as masseurs in Chengdu and lived a "suffering" life. Later, I went to work in a massage shop in Shanghai, and the two of them were ranked among the "top one or two in the shop."

;

;In 2005, when Xia Qiong went home to give birth, she received health care products from Zhang Hong from Shanghai. She knew that her husband was "troublesome" again. Zhang Hong quit his job behind her back and went to work in sales. "He sometimes told people that he couldn't find a way out in the subway in Shanghai. He was trapped in the subway and at an intersection on the road in Shanghai." Xia Qiong said, "He wanted to let others I feel that blind people can not only be masseurs, but also do other things."

;

;In 2019, after climbing the 7,500-meter Muztagh Peak, Zhang Hong decided to prepare for climbing Mount Everest. In order to save money, he adopted the most cost-effective training method - climbing stairs. While climbing, I put on mountain boots and an oxygen-blocking mask, and carried more than 20 kilograms of weight at the same time. I climbed for three to four hours every day. He lived in the hospital's apartment building and climbed from the first floor to the twelfth floor and then took the elevator down every day. When he met his colleagues in the hospital, he felt pressure. "Countless people around him questioned him, thinking that this guy was not only blind, but also crazy."

;

;Enduring the strange looks from people around him and the difficulty of raising funds, Countless times, after he got on the elevator, his fingers hesitated and hesitated between the first floor and the floor where his home was located. "I have been struggling like this for two years."

;

;"Some people may think that it is enough for their wives to have enough food and clothing, and for their children to have money and study; some people think that they should set an example for their children, so that the people they love can have a bright face in front of and behind others." Xia Qiong said that her husband Zhang Hong "may be the latter."

;

;After Zhang Hong successfully climbed Mount Everest, some subtle changes occurred. People in the hospital used to refer to Zhang Hong as "Dr. Xia's husband." Now, they call her "Zhang Hong's wife."

;

;When her son was two years old, Xia Qiong and a relative turned off the lights and asked her son in the darkness: Who do you want to protect when it gets dark? The two-year-old son said sweetly: Protect daddy. Xia Qiong and her female relatives were puzzled: We are all women, why should we protect our father? The son said without thinking: Because dad can’t see. Today, the son feels that his father is "very capable" and "relatively strong."

;

;范立欣和夏琼都观察到，攀登珠峰成功之后，生活中的张洪变得松弛许多。失明之后，他曾一度难以接受弱人一等的感受。他和每一个普通人一样有自己的缺点，但他宁愿听到平视的批评，也不要俯视的褒奖。

;

;“攀登珠峰之前，我在外面那么多年，从来不跟别人讲起我家人的事情，只有我老婆知道，除此之外没有第三个人知道，但是珠峰下来以后，我可以跟任何人分享我家里发生的任何事情，包括我爸爸、叔叔看不见，以前我是没有办法面对，现在我可以从容地面对这些事情。”张洪说。
